#Text=West Michigan
#Text=West Michigan is roughly the westernmost third of the " palm " of the Lower Pensinsula of Michigan .
#Text=It includes most of the Lake Michigan shoreline , as well as the nearby cities and towns , farmland , and woodland .
#Text=Cities
#Text=— Home of Kelloggs and Post cereals .
#Text=- second largest city in Michigan
#Text=- home to Western Michigan University
#Text=Understand
#Text=Western Michigan is more commonly called " West Michigan " by the locals , which helps avoid confusion between the region and Western Michigan University .

column1: #Text=It 's Michigan 's " Bible Belt " , a region with a strong Dutch Calvinist heritage and conservative politics .
#Text=It is gradually becoming more cosmopolitan as the population diversifies , especially in the larger cities .

#Text=It is also home to the extensive sandy beaches of Lake Michigan , which – if not for the cooler salt-free water and smaller waves – could perhaps be mistaken for the beaches of the Pacific Ocean .
#Text=The region 's economy has traditionally been based on manufacturing and tourism , with the latter gaining in prominence in recent years , by default .
#Text=Grand Rapids is the unofficial capital of West Michigan ; the regions away from G.R. often refer to themselves as " Southwest " or " Northwest " Michigan .
#Text=Talk
#Text=Everybody thinks they speak " without an accent " , but this notion is especially strong in Western Michigan , and not without some justification .
#Text=A local legend says that the residents of one city or another in the area have the " standard " pronunciation of American English .
#Text=While this is probably apocryphal , local pronunciation is virtually indistinguishable from that heard in most Hollywood movies and national TV newscasts .
#Text=If you 're used to those , you should have little difficulty understanding people here .

#Text=But visitors with " exotic " accents from places such as Brisbane , Bangalore , or Boston might have to speak slowly to be understood by the unpracticed ear of the natives , and the natives may have to speak slowly to make themselves understood to these visitors .
#Text=By plane
#Text=Gerald R. Ford International Airport ( GRR ) , Grand Rapids .
#Text=The biggest and busiest airport in the region , with regular flights from major cities and airline hubs across the country .
#Text=Served by almost all major airlines .

#Text=Fares in and out of GRR are often more expensive than the larger hubs in Detroit and Chicago , but the price difference has been gradually decreasing with the introduction of low-cost carriers in Grand Rapids .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Despite its large geographical size , it is easy to get around in West Michigan .
#Text=Major highways and a lack of heavy traffic means you are rarely more than an hour from the Lake and its sandy beaches , fresh water and quaint shoreline towns .
#Text=Highway 131 bisects the region on the north-south axis , connecting Kalamazoo and Grand Rapids to the Mackinac Bridge to the north .
#Text=I-94 , the highway that connects Chicago with Detroit , cuts through the southern portion of the region .
#Text=Highway 196 runs along the lakeshore from the southwestern corner of the state to Grand Rapids .
#Text=I-96 connects the lakeshore at Muskegon through Grand Rapids to Lansing , the state capital .
#Text=See
#Text=The shoreline along Lake Michigan resembles an ocean shore more than it does the shores of most lakes .
#Text=The prevailing winds from the west have transformed Michigan 's west coast into hundreds of miles of sandy beaches and dunes .

#Text=The Lake ( the definite article and uppercase letter always refer to Lake Michigan ) stretches to the horizon and beyond , so you can watch the sun set into it much as you would on the Gulf coast of Florida or the Pacific coast of the U.S.
#Text=Do
#Text=Geocaching .
#Text=http://www.geocaching.com.
#Text=There are many parks in the area in which to go geocaching .
#Text=See geocaching.com to find the caches , then load them into your GPS unit .
#Text=Geocaches requires a GPS unit to find .
#Text=The caches can be almost any size .
#Text=Larger caches are easier to find , smaller can be much harder as they can be the size of a bolt head or film canister and can be hidden in a very devious manner .
#Text=Great fun for people who like puzzles or being detectives .
#Text=Some caches have several stages and are puzzle-based .
#Text=Some caches just give you the coordinates .
#Text=Fun for all ages .
#Text=John Ball Zoo .
#Text=After June 20 , depending on weather , they also have a stingray and shark petting and feeding pool for a small extra charge .
#Text=Feeding times about 1pm , but they might vary .
#Text=Just outside the zoo , sometimes there are music or other events here , and the occasional reptile show .
#Text=Meijer Gardens .
#Text=http://www.meijergardens.org/calendar/. Indoor and outdoor gardens to walk through , lots of art and statuary .
#Text=Live butterfly exhibit in March and April each year for a small extra cost , fun for kids too ( mostly in outside gardens ) .
#Text=In December each year there is a Trees from Around the World exhibit .
#Text=Gift shop .
#Text=Many different biomes inside from desert , the Edwardian , to carnivorous plants .
#Text=Metal Detecting .
#Text=Metal detecting rules vary by park and county , but in general , you can metal detect in county parks if you do n't dig anything up .
#Text=I. e. the item MUST be on the surface of the soil .
#Text=Metal detecting can only be done in SOME state parks and can be done ONLY in certain areas .
#Text=Get the map of the state park for metal detecting .
#Text=Here is a link to Michigan state parks and metal detecting rules , and MD maps .
#Text=Air Zoo .
#Text=- located in Portage
#Text=Drink
#Text=There are wineries in the southwestern and northwestern areas of the state , and some of them have been winning national awards as of late .
#Text=You can also find microbreweries in most major cities in West Michigan .
#Text=http://www.bellsbeer.com/
#Text=http://www.newhollandbrew.com/
#Text=http://www.arcadiabrewingcompany.com/
#Text=http://www.foundersbrewing.com/
#Text=Stay safe
#Text=Other than stupidity and visiting a few neighborhoods in the larger cities at night , there is not much that will hurt you .
#Text=West Michigan is notoriously safe .
#Text=It is not uncommon to see young women walking alone at midnight , perfectly safe .
#Text=With a low crime rate and a very law-and-order population , staying safe is easy as long as you exercise common sense .
